title: 103_hr929
content: Increase in threshold requirement for wages defined in the Internal Revenue Code and Social Security Act from $50 to $300. Coordination of collection of domestic service employment with income taxes through an amendment in Chapter 25 of the Internal Revenue Code. SEC. 3510: Coordination of collection of domestic service employment taxes with income taxes. The text outlines the rules for filing returns for domestic service employment taxes on a calendar year basis. Returns must be filed by the 15th day of the fourth month following the close of the employer's taxable year. No deposit requirements apply to these taxes. Domestic service employment taxes are subject to estimated tax provisions for the employer's taxable year. The text explains the rules for domestic service employment taxes, including annualization adjustments and a transitional rule for the taxable year beginning in 1994. Domestic service employment taxes refer to taxes on remuneration for domestic service in a private home. The text outlines rules for domestic service employment taxes, excluding certain types of service in a private home of the employer. Regulations may exempt employers liable for other employment taxes. The Secretary will prescribe necessary regulations for this section. The Secretary is authorized to enter agreements with states to collect state unemployment taxes on remuneration for domestic service in a private home. Amounts collected under these agreements will be treated as domestic service employment taxes for coordination with income taxes. The Secretary can enter agreements with states to collect state unemployment taxes on remuneration for domestic service in a private home. The collected amounts will be transferred to the State's account in the Unemployment Trust Fund and treated as a tax imposed by chapter 23 for coordination with income taxes. The term 'State' is defined as per section 3306(j)(1). Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 25 of the Code. The amendments made by section 3510 coordinate the collection of domestic service employment taxes with income taxes, applying to remuneration paid after 1993.
